text:
She opened her eyes, blood on her lips. 

"So this is your room, Sonia," she whispered. 

Sonia looked pained. 

"We ruined you, Sonia. Polenka, Lida, Kolya, come here! Take them all!" 

"Enough!" she gasped. 

"Lay me down. Let me die in peace." 

They eased her onto the pillow. 

"Not the priest. I have no sins. God knows my suffering." 

She trembled, eyes darting. 

"Amalia Ludwigovna," she murmured, breath shallow. 

"Make haste! Be graceful!" 

"Du hast die schonsten Augen, was willst du mehr?" 

Her voice faded into delirium.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Katerina Ivanovna, in a state of delirium and suffering, expresses her despair and resignation while entrusting her children to Sonia.
